item.description:
Microsoft Office Integration With Java  

 

Whether we like it or not, Microsoft Office is the standard format for information sharing both within and across organizations. J2EE applications like Content Management Systems (CMS), Business Process Management Systems all need to support MS Office documents. In these systems and others there is a need for manipulating office document content in a Java/J2EE environment. This talk provides an introduction to generating and manipulating Microsoft Office documents and spreadsheets using Java APIs. We will review the  Open Packaging Convention (OPC) and Open Office XML schema (OOXML) and illustrate how to manipulate document content using standard Java APIs.

 

 

Ed Sumitra A software engineer proficient in bringing together multiple technologies and languages from jQuery and GWT based UI interfaces to C# web services and J2EE and Spring based server code with a focus on integrating disparate systems.
item.name: Java and Microsoft Office
